member.summary: Option for RSA public key file used with the SHA-256 based authentication.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Constants.MYSQLI_CLIENT_SSL
member.summary: Use SSL (encrypted protocol). This option should not be set by application programs; it is set internally in the MySQL client library

member.summary: Use compression protocol.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Constants.MYSQLI_CLIENT_INTERACTIVE
member.summary: Allow interactive_timeout seconds (instead of wait_timeout seconds) of inactivity before closing the connection. The client's session wait_timeout variable will be set to the value of the session interactive_timeout variable.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Constants.MYSQLI_CLIENT_IGNORE_SPACE
member.summary: Allow spaces after function names. Makes all functions names reserved words.

member.summary: For using buffered resultsets.

member.summary: For using unbuffered resultsets.

member.summary: Add items keyed by column names.

member.summary: Add items keyed by column indices.

member.summary: Add both items keyed by column names and items keyd by column indices.

member.summary: Turns reporting off.

member.summary: Report errors from mysqli function calls.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Constants.MYSQLI_REPORT_STRICT
member.summary: Throw a for errors instead of warnings.

member.name: F:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Constants.MYSQLI_REPORT_INDEX
member.summary: Report if no index or bad index was used in a query.

member.summary: Set all options on (report all).

member.name: M:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Functions.mysqli_fetch_assoc(Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.mysqli_result)
member.summary: Fetch a result row as an associative array.
member.returns:
Returns an associative array of strings representing the fetched row in the result set, where each key in the array represents the name of one of the result set's columns or NULL if there are no more rows in resultset.
If two or more columns of the result have the same field names, the last column will take precedence. To access the other column(s) of the same name, you either need to access the result with numeric indices by using mysqli_fetch_row() or add alias names.

member.name: M:Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.Functions.mysqli_fetch_array(Peachpie.Library.MySql.MySqli.mysqli_result,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetch a result row as an associative, a numeric array, or both.
